title: Is Spotify about to enter the hardware game? Reports say wearable on the way | Trusted Reviews
description:
![spotify
1](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-
placeholder-3.svg)

**Spotify is preparing to enter the hardware game, judging by job
opportunities recently posted online.**

The firm is seeking a [senior hardware product
manager](https://www.spotify.com/us/jobs/view/o9X14fwV/) that could “deliver
hardware directly from Spotify to existing and new customers.”

A “trusted source” at
[ZatsNotFunny](https://techcrunch.com/2017/04/24/spotify-hardware/) says this
product is a “wearable.”

Spotify didn’t go into specifics on the type of hardware it has in mind, but
the posting outlines a “category defining product akin to Pebble Watch, Amazon
Echo and Snap Spectacles.”

This appears to suggest Spotify has something completely new in mind that
could have a knock on impact across the rest of the tech industry.

**Related:**[ **What is Spotify Climatune?**  
](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/spotify-and-accuweather-debut-climatune-
service) Is Spotify working on some sort of wearable device, as the original
report suggests? Perhaps it’s a new breed of voice-controlled connected
speaker or perhaps even specs with built-in headphones?

There are more clues within the other job listings. There’s a [product manager
position](https://www.spotify.com/us/jobs/view/oPi84fw3/) available where the
successful candidate will be working with “major external platform providers
within the voice space.”

Meanwhile another product manager will be working on teams “dedicated to
building the components of the Spotify conversational interface.”

While there’s no guarantee the latter two positions involve working on the
hardware project, there’s at least a hint Spotify is taking voice commands
more seriously.
